group_1.narration: Some time after I'd moved into my apartment,@my legal guardian reached out to me.
Apparently Teach was sending out invitations@for her upcoming wedding, but she didn't@have my address.

group_1.textCenter: (I reckon it's the same top-class guy she@was telling me about back then.)
(She kept going on and on about him...)
(Maybe I was the one getting@in the way of their marriage.)
(Now that I'm living on my own,@they were finally able to push forward.)
(If the reason Teach couldn't get married@before was because of my magic,)
(then the effect has already come and gone...)

group_1.narration: At that time, I really wanted to attend.@I yearned to see the woman that I@was so indebted to get her happy ever after.
I was just looking at it in the way@that was most convenient for me.
If the effects of my misfortune had already played out,@then it should be safe for me to go.
That's what I wanted to believe, so while@I decided not to attend the ceremony itself,@I did go to watch in secret.
Seeing Teach dressed up as a bride from outside@the chapel was a truly beautiful sight.
I felt bad that I might have been what postponed@this wonderful moment of happiness for her.
But that aside, I could only feel gratitude for@the fact that she'd made even my dead heart able@to rejoice at the happiness of others.
As I looked at Teach's happy figure,@the image of my friends who had been killed in@the troupe flashed through my mind, and I thought@I could tell everyone, "I'm alive and well."

group_1.textCenter: Hey, don't go jumping like that,@you'll step on the hem of your dress.
(But I guess that just shows@how happy you are that I came...)
Teach, have yourself a full and happy life.

group_1.narration: [flashEffect:flashRed2]*THUD!*
That moment seemed to last an eternity,@playing out in slow motion as it@burned itself into the backs of my eyelids.
A huge tractor tire, so big that it made me question@that anything so large could exist in this world,@came flying down the road like a bullet.
And then it crashed mercilessly into Teach,@who was beaming with a radiant smile,@bringing about calamity.
A pure white dress danced and twisted through@the air, and was dashed against the trees,@while I watched on, struck dumb by what I'd seen.@A small ring rolled to a stop before me.
Teach's wedding band reproached me.
This happened because I showed up.
"You were so happy you could die...?@What a farce..."

group_1.textCenter: Really, even the slightest indulgence is intolerable?
What sort of life even is this...?

group_1.textRight: Looks like you've got quite@the impurity in your Soul Gem.

group_1.textLeft: Really... It seems to express my mood spot on...
I'm sure it won't be long now@before it turns pitch black.

group_1.textRight: It doesn't matter to me, but you don't@seem to care about becoming a Witch.

group_1.textLeft: I've already seen it with my own eyes,@quite some time ago.
We fight Witches in exchange@for having a wish granted,
but in the end, rather than being saved,@we become Witches ourselves.
We don't leave anything behind, we don't@accomplish anything, we just scatter curses.

group_1.textRight: When you become a Witch, you generate@an enormous amount of energy.
and use it to sustain the universe.
So, though it may be indirect, you can@say that you leave something behind.

group_1.textLeft: So you created Magical Girls in@order to sustain the universe?

group_1.narration: Just when I was about to become a Witch,@Kyubey appeared out of nowhere as though it@had seen this coming, and started speaking@leisurely about sustaining the universe.
At that time, my head was filled with both a strong@resentment at the way that thing played with people's@souls, as well as a sudden radiant feeling of hope.
I had realized a way that I could live that@wouldn't bring about misfortune with my every move.@A sense of refreshing invigoration filled me,@as though I'd just awakened from a long sleep.

group_1.textLeft: From now on, I will live for you, and for the universe.

group_1.narration: If Magical Girls exist to generate the energy@that maintains the universe, then I'll@just have to fulfill that quota.
I figured that, if everything I do from now on@is for the sake of Kyubey and the universe,@then no matter who I show kindness to,@it's Kyubey and the universe that will take the blow.
If that puts an end to Kyubey, that's great.@If Magical Girls are released from their horrid fate,@that'd give my life some meaning.

group_1.textLeft: I will live for the dead, and grant them salvation.
There are so many misfortunate@children in the world, not just me.
And one day, everyone will be saved.
